We work with and support service-members and veterans to withdraw military support from the occupations of Iraq and Afghanistan, supporting resistance within the military that empowers service members to have a voice and develop as leaders organizing for change. To help build this GI-led movement, we work with fellow civilians to build a reliable, committed and experienced support structure for military personnel.  We believe that organizing to withdraw military support from the war can not only win tangible victories, but can also be a transformative process whereby vets and civilians develop the skills and confidence necessary to organize for long-term change."

description: John Helmeke  shared a  post  to  Craig Baumbusch 's Timeline.

John Helmeke SUNDAY ELECTIONS IN BERLIN (SEPTEMBER 18, 2016).  The Social Democratic Party (SPD) and the Christian Democratic Union (CDU), very roughly the equivalent of the Democrats and the Republicans in the United States - though German politics are much farther to the political Left than American politics.  Berlin is thought of as the most tolerant and cosmopolitan city in Germany.  According to zeit.de, of the parties receiving seats in the German capital's own city legislature, the SDP is down -6.7% to 21.6%. The CDU is down to -5.7% to 17.6% between the previous election and this election. The Linke (Left) party is up +3.9 to 15.6% of the vote.  The Grüne (Green) Party is down -2.4% to 15.2% of the vote.  The AfD (Alternative for Germany) party - opposing Germany's open door policy under Chancellor Angela Merkel (the German leader who is a member of the CDU party), under which one million asylum seekers entered Germany last year - is up +14.2, from 0% in the previous election, to 14.2% of the vote.  The Free Democratic Party - which to my understanding of it, complicated in its politics, supports Germany's social welfare state but favors running the economy on the principles of classical liberal (neo-liberal) economic theory of reducing debt and imposing austerity in times of economic recession and depression - is up 4.9% to 6.7% of the vote in this election.

‎ George Douvris IV ‎   to   Craig Baumbusch THE DNC MASQUERADE PARTY IN PHILADELPHIA by GEORGE DOUVRIS  Congratulations to the Hillary Clinton supporters  celebrating her nomination.  If Hillary becomes president you can be well assured that you will have the preferred "future to believe in" that you deserve. Through her campaign doners and personal assurances, Monsanto and GMOs  will control our food supply, fossil fuels will make record profits, the TPP will successfully eliminate the middle class, banks will increase their fortunes from credit card debt and college student loans (not to mention foreign debtors like China smiling in collecting their loans and investments), black kids will continue filling the private prison industry from possession of small amounts of pot, police state activities from expanded surveillance and militarized police forces, fraking companies extracting more oil while communities experience earthquakes and drought, pharmaceutical and insurance companies getting even more profits and tax loopholes, most Americans not being able to afford going to the hospital because of no universal health insurance, and of course permanent war that will build up the military industrial complex  from puppet regimes installed to steal other countries oil resources.  As most other political, environmental and cultural activists, I felt that during the late 1960's a growing awareness of social needs was leading our country into a more positive direction. Yet this manifestation of humanism was short lived and deflected as the empire of vested interests struck back. While many of us marched along with Martin Luther King and Bernie Sanders to end wars, racism and oppression, both the Clintons were recruited by the CIA in college and to spy on these same activist groups. Hillary was even fired from the Watergate investigation for "lying and being unethical".  Many people turned their back on the global poverty and environmental devastation that has been expanding to horrible proportions Ever since.  Media and political propaganda created an apathetic  society of sheeple willing to go along with the promises of wealth and power in the financial interests of an imperialist empire. False flag operations likewise launched a mindset eager to give up their freedoms because of a relentless fear of "terrorism".  We certainly are being terrorized but not by foreign entities but by local conglomerates of power and wealth.   Songwriter Leonard Cohen sings:  Everybody knows that the dice are loaded   Everybody rolls with their fingers crossed   Everybody knows that the war is over   Everybody knows the good guys lost   Everybody knows the fight was fixed   The poor stay poor, the rich get rich   The rich have got their channels in the bedrooms of the poor."  Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. famously said "no one is free until we are all free."  And paraphrasing the words of visionary musician Jimi Hendrix, British statesman William Gladstone and Indian spiritual teacher Sri Chimnoy: "When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace".    John Lennon realized that  "All you need is Love"  and to "Give Peace a Chance." Jesus Christ would never ask "who should we drone first"  and likewise reminds us "Do unto others as you would have them do unto you". Bible students take heed of Satan offering Jesus all the military and financial riches of the world but He clearly told the demon to "get lost". He also reiterated that it is easier for a blind man to walk through the eye of a needle than someone pursuing riches to enter the kingdom of heaven." And when He kicked out the banking cartel from the temple for making money from money lent as in usury"  the scribes lobbied for his death penalty. Lennon and Christ would both make better Commander in Chiefs than war hawks like Clinton or Trump.  Clinton proudly proclaims that war criminals with blood on their hands Kissinger and Albright have been her role models and mentors as secretary of state.  Similar to a familiar Biblical story, this year's election has brought on its own version of a crucifixion. The mainstream media scribes have lied and distorted Bernie's very rational message of compassion and healing of our broken political system. And just as the Hebrews, people that consider themselves a progressive and socially conscious  society have turned their back on Bernie and in essence asking for the system to crucify him. A statesman of Bernie's quality only comes around once in a lifetime. We must not be led astray and continue  to support him in every way possible.   Bernie Sanders has rekindled the hope that America can once more realign itself to those values of honesty, compassion and justice. The political revolution is not over while awareness is growing that something is terribly wrong as our votes have become a meaningless joke and that democracy has been hijacked and morphed into "demockery" instead.  The dirty tricks of the Clinton campaign have been a slap in the face to anyone that has enough attention span to realize what is going on. Every primary this year has seen voter suppression, "flipped" voting machines and worse. Like thousands of other Sanders supporters, facebook has locked me out of my account that consisted mostly of Bernie individual and group contacts. Have we really reached the 1984 police state of corporate engineered totalitarianism?   We are being entertained by Clinton who has promised to be generous in adapting many of Bernie's progressive proposals. Having such a long history of lies, who in their right mind would believe her? The idea of voting for her instead of Trump as the "lesser of two evils" is likewise a joke. This year's political "game" has been staged to maximize not only a grand deception but also to increase television audience  profits from the sensationalism and contrived interest of Trump's candidacy. Like the wrestling shows that he has appeared on, Trump is the bad guy who the audience reacts to by cheering on the hero who in this case is Hillary Clinton. But as the Trumps and Clintons are close friends outside the political ring, the truth is that they are still two faces of the same string pulled by the corporate puppet masters. Both of them represent the same domestic and foreign policies though the media spins a different image. When even  every poll shows that Bernie beats Trump by a wide margin yet Hillary struggles to  keep up, why is there even an issue as to why Bernie Sanders is not going to be the Democratic  nominee. Perhaps he would have had to make more promises to Wall Street as did Hillary with her $350,000 secret speeches to Goldman Sachs private meetings.   So as the Hillary Clinton parade is marching along to fanfare and celebration. Perhaps she can invite her husband Slick Billy to play his saxophone in the same way as Nero played a fiddle while Rome burned. His "free trade"  policies  were another blow to the working class of America in the same way that Hillary's work as an attorney for Wall Mart made sure the big ships from China brought in lots of cheap goods yet went back empty with no products from our country to sell there. And as a bonus, wrecking the mom and pops small stores that the Wall Marts  would drive out of business through the cheaper goods made in essentially slave factories.   And curiously, why are the many millions of dollars donated to the Clinton Foundation for the relief of victims in Haiti several years ago still collecting interest and not being distributed.  Don't be blinded by the Clinton's "Welcome to the Machine" bandwagon of empty promises which Pink Floyd warmed us about. Wake up out of the matrix of grand deception and not be misled by mainstream media salesmen and sold out pundits. Aristotle clearly called for focus with the axim "Know Thyself" and Timothy Leary simply said "Just say Know."    Economist Paul Krugman warns us that America is  on its way to becoming a "boiled frog". As he puts it "I’m referring, of course, to the proverbial frog that, placed in a pot of cold water that is gradually heated, never realizes the danger it’s in and is boiled alive. Real frogs will, in fact, jump out of the pot — but never mind. The hypothetical boiled frog is a useful metaphor for a very real problem: the difficulty of responding to disasters that creep up on you a bit at a time. And creeping disasters are what we mostly face these days."  Kenneth Tynan stated in Edinburgh in 1967  "I attacked those Western playwrights who use their influence and affluence to preach to the world the nihilistic doctrine that life is pointless and irrationally destructive, and that there is nothing we can do about it. Until everyone is  fed, clothed, housed and taught, until human beings have equal leisure to contemplate the overwhelming fact of mortality, we should not (I argued) indulge in the luxury of "privileged despair."  One of the founding fathers of the US government Thomas Jefferson wanted to make sure that people always remembered  "When the representative body have lost the confidence of their constituents, when they have notoriously made sale of their most valuable rights, when they have assumed to themselves powers which the people never put into their hands, then indeed their continuing in office becomes dangerous to the state, and calls for an exercise of the power of dissolution."   Indeed a political revolution is long overdue. The Democratic Party Convention in Philadelphia will be the moment of truth and nomination of Bernie Sanders or a continuation of the same political machinery that has brought the world to a gloomy future which we should not believe in.   I doubt if many of the people I quoted in this essay would be marching in the Clinton parade, so you will be in fine company if you aren't either. Let's make sure we help Bernie in every way to be elected president while we still can. It ain't over yet.  FEEL FREE TO SHARE THIS ESSAY

John Helmeke PROJECT: BREAKTHROUGH STARSHOT - Space Probes Weighing Only a Single Gram, Powered by Light, Would Reach 1/5 the Speed of Light.........  Proxima b, rotating around Proxima Centuri, the star nearest to the sun and the Earth, "...is 4.6 million miles from its [sun, the] red dwarf star [Proxima Centauri], or just one-twentieth of the distance between Earth and the sun. [The Earth is 93 million miles from the sun.] That would likely mean an incredible orange sky with no blue, so it looks like a perpetual sunset. And if that's not different enough, the planet circles its star so quickly that its year is about 11 days. The planet doesn't rotate, so one side is always facing its star and the other side is always dark and colder. It is bombarded with X-rays and ultraviolet light...  Earlier this year, an all-star team of scientists and business leaders including Stephen Hawking announced Breakthrough Starshot , a project to send out hundreds of light-powered space probes that would weigh about a gram, travel at one-fifth the speed of light and send pictures back to Earth.

TWO BOOKS BY GEORGE DOUVRIS  CROSSING MORE KARMA ZONES, THE FAMILY ODYSSEY continues where the  journey of my first book ends as together with my wife, three children, and at times 92 year old mother, we move out of the US to seek a new homeland. Eight years of experiences take place in a small Greek village and afterwards our family odyssey takes us through India, Thailand, Bali, Fiji, New Zealand and Australia before landing again in Hawaii.  Lots of adventures and reflections that I'm sure you will enjoy. Also poetry and my political and cultural essays  A few of the reviewers of my new book include STANLEY KRIPPNER,CARL FREEDMAN,ED THIELK,RUSSELL RUDERMAN,LEE UNDERWOOD,CHRIS DYER,PETER TERRY,HARVEY MARTIN JAMES FADIMAN,SCOTT TEITSWORTH AND CHRIS KILHAM   https://www.facebook.com/DouvrisFamily/  For a limited time I am offering a 10% discount on the book and if you wish to purchase both of my books 20% off the total price.   My first book, CROSSING KARMA ZONES, THE JOURNEY BEGINS  are lively tales of growing up in a Greek-American family in the southern part of the US during the 1950's and then coming of age during a backdrop of civil rights unrest in the 60's. I find purpose in anti-Vietnam war activism and then follow the exciting hippie trail to the Woodstock festival and then moving to Haight Ashbury in San Francisco. Through my eclectic integration of humor and reflection through the many exciting passages of my experiences across space and time. description: ‎ Jay Lindberg ‎   to   Craig Baumbusch A RAY OF HOPE Jay Lindberg 5/22/17  The role of Methane in climate science.  Jay, is there any turning back (from the mass extinction event) at this point?  Hi Peggy. The science is very simple. There is over 10 trillion tons of frozen methane (Methane Hydrate) on the planet. Methane hydrate is found on the ocean floors, permafrost, extreme cold regions of Continental shelves. Frozen methane is stable and not a threat to the species.  There is now over 10 billion tons of methane in our atmosphere. The release of methane in the Arctic, permafrost, East Siberian Arctic shelf, Ocean floor, Greenland Tectonic plate, etc. is accelerating and not under our control. Methane is a very powerful greenhouse gas and 100 times more potent than CO2 over a ten year period. The threat of mass extinction is no longer about CO2. CO2 was the trigger. Methane is the bullet. Every one of these regions have many times more methane in frozen form (methane Hydrate) than is needed to trigger a global extinction event. Every one of these regions are at present, unstable and releasing large quantities of methane gas but not enough to kill us, yet.  Turning back- Is there any way we can turn back from our mass extinction event? If there is a way, it would require turning back modern industrial society in a very major way because it is the heat engine that drives the process.  The real question is, can any of us survive (1) the collapse of modern industrial civilization (2) through the mass extermination of species in (3) an environmental collapse and (4) toxic biosphere?  My Answer: We will be burying our children in a very short time because we did not separate rhetoric from reality. We poisoned a beautiful blue planet full of life and triggered a mass extinction event that included all of us.  So what do we do now? I am looking for a mate to love for the rest of our short life. I do not wish to die alone and at this point I need that attachment as a reason to stay in this fight. A cold beer and a front row seat at the mass extinction event is the other option.  So be kind to one another, don't be so damn greedy, protect mother earth, don't accept lies from the government as fact,  challenge corruption, Live your life with courage, challenge and conquer your fears.
